Predictive Fail metric for host

With unit tests
This patch improves doc, commit
message and responded to comments i
regarding content of plugin in
prior patch

commit_message:
Fix ceilometer not consuming .start events from heat

Ceilometer didn't acknowledge .start events comming
from heat.

Change-Id: I20ae2a2f92740ef48227f4ed1bef5e031c61de77
Closes-Bug: 1361133

commit_message:
Default description update for threshold-type-alarm

Default description should be updated automatically when
fields in description i.e. threshold, comparision operator, statistic
period and meter-name are updated in threshold-type-alarm.

Change-Id: Ida7e4e42b6bbc6e839aaf5f8df3b777107d044c2
Closes-Bug: #1325436
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/77/97777/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return dict((k.replace('.', ':').replace(':', '.', 1), unicode(v)) def as_dict(self, db_model,change_description=False): if change_description == True: d['description'] = 'Alarm when %s is %s a %s of %d.0 over %d seconds' % \ (d['rule']['meter_name'], d['rule']['comparison_operator'], d['rule']['statistic'], d['rule']['threshold'], d['rule']['period']) change_description=False default_description='Alarm when %s is %s a %s of %d.0 over %d seconds' % \ (old_alarm['rule']['meter_name'], old_alarm['rule']['comparison_operator'], old_alarm['rule']['statistic'], old_alarm['rule']['threshold'], old_alarm['rule']['period']) #checking if previous description was default_description if old_alarm['description'] == default_description: #checking if user has not upadted the description and if he is using the default one if data.description == old_alarm['description']: change_description=True updated_alarm = data.as_dict(storage.models.Alarm,change_description)
deleted_lines: return dict((k.replace('.', ':').replace(':', '.', 1), six.text_type(v)) def as_dict(self, db_model): updated_alarm = data.as_dict(storage.models.Alarm)

commit_message:
Add Keystone ec2-credentials scenarios

This submission adds methods to basic.py and utils.py
under rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone

Add configuration files for ec2-credentials
operations
1) create-and-list-ec2credentials.json
2) create-and-list-ec2credentials.yaml
3) create-and-delete-ec2credential.json
4) create-and-delete-ec2credential.yaml

Add unittests to test_utils.py and test_basic.py

Co-Authored-By: Ravikumar Venkatesan <ravikumar.venkatesan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Icdc786a144a42e983c79f70262e1f785dbe99e44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/60/178060/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: KeystoneBasic.create_and_list_ec2credentials: - runner: type: "constant" times: 10 concurrency: 5 context: users: tenants: 2 users_per_tenant: 2 sla: failure_rate: max: 0 KeystoneBasic.create_and_delete_ec2credential: - runner: type: "constant" times: 10 concurrency: 5 context: users: tenants: 2 users_per_tenant: 2 sla: failure_rate: max: 0

subject: Split bunch of samples into multiple messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-19 09:21:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/9a8992df2f85d7876baeec023b7a4a8cc390c2a6', 'message': 'Split bunch of samples into multiple messages

Currently, single message may contain large amount of samples,
which slows down the collector on storing samples to backend database.
With this patch, large amount of samples will be split into multiple messages,
which can effectively make use of multiple workers.

commit_message:
Split bunch of samples into multiple messages

Currently, single message may contain large amount of samples,
which slows down the collector on storing samples to backend database.
With this patch, large amount of samples will be splitted into multiple messages,
which can effectively make use of multiple workers.

Change-Id: Idf22c66ca7626c4061ac1b527144d5d9db8b7516
Closes-bug: #1291923
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/55/94155/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ceilometer.publisher import utils as publisher_utils from ceilometer import utils cfg.IntOpt('split_threshold', default=0, help='Maximum number of samples that message splitting ' 'does not occur. 0 means never split.'),def get_workers(): workers = (cfg.CONF.get('collector_workers') or utils.cpu_count()) if workers and workers < 1: workers = 1 return workers def get_split_threshold(): threshold = cfg.CONF.publisher_rpc.get('split_threshold') if threshold < 0: threshold = 0 return threshold self.workers = get_workers() self.split_threshold = get_split_threshold() split_samples_list = self._split_samples(samples) for samples_list in split_samples_list: meters = [ publisher_utils.meter_message_from_counter( sample, cfg.CONF.publisher.metering_secret) for sample in samples_list ] LOG.audit(_('Publishing %(m)d samples on %(t)s') % ( {'m': len(meters), 't': topic})) self.local_queue.append((context, topic, meters)) if self.per_meter_topic: for meter_name, meter_list in itertools.groupby( sorted(meters, key=operator.itemgetter('counter_name')), operator.itemgetter('counter_name')): meter_list = list(meter_list) topic_name = topic + '.' + meter_name LOG.audit(_('Publishing %(m)d samples on %(n)s') % ( {'m': len(meter_list), 'n': topic_name})) self.local_queue.append((context, topic_name, meter_list)) def _split_samples(self, samples): split_number = self.workers samples_length = len(samples) if (split_number == 1 or self.split_threshold == 0 or samples_length <= self.split_threshold): return [samples] # Split samples into split_number of chunks. In order to balance # the size of chunks, the first half of chunks (1 to remainder) # contain number+1 samples for each. The latter half contain number # samples for each. number = samples_length / split_number remainder = samples_length % split_number if remainder > 0: results = self._split(samples, 0, (number + 1) * remainder, number + 1) if number > 0: results.extend(self._split(samples, (number + 1) * remainder, samples_length, number)) else: results = self._split(samples, 0, samples_length, number) return results def _split(self, samples, start, stop, step): return [samples[i:i + step] for i in range(start, stop, step)]
deleted_lines: from ceilometer.publisher import utils meters = [ utils.meter_message_from_counter( sample, cfg.CONF.publisher.metering_secret) for sample in samples ] LOG.audit(_('Publishing %(m)d samples on %(t)s') % ( {'m': len(meters), 't': topic})) self.local_queue.append((context, topic, meters)) if self.per_meter_topic: for meter_name, meter_list in itertools.groupby( sorted(meters, key=operator.itemgetter('counter_name')), operator.itemgetter('counter_name')): meter_list = list(meter_list) topic_name = topic + '.' + meter_name LOG.audit(_('Publishing %(m)d samples on %(n)s') % ( {'m': len(meter_list), 'n': topic_name})) self.local_queue.append((context, topic_name, meter_list))

commit_message:
VMware vSphere Declarative Polling

- Added 'inspect_declared_meters()' in the 'Inspector' class. It will be
responsible for inspecting the values of all meters declared in the
corresponding config file, for any given instance.

- Implemented 'DeclarativePollster' which will call the
Inspector.inspect_declared_meters() and generate samples for all
declared meters.

- Implemented the inspect_declared_meters() in 'VsphereInspector'.

- Enabled 'VsphereOperations' to be able to query the stats for a list
of counters (instead of one) for any VM.

Change-Id: I8796b7ddecbf0062beb83c6668c9ce1eaf7407af
Implements: blueprint vmware-vsphere-declarative-polling
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/29/114829/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 VMware, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from ceilometer.compute import plugin from ceilometer.compute.pollsters import util from ceilometer.compute.virt import inspector as virt_inspector from ceilometer.openstack.common import log LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class DeclarativePollster(plugin.ComputePollster): def get_samples(self, manager, cache, resources): for instance in resources: LOG.info(_('checking instance %s'), instance.id) try: meter_infos = manager.inspector.inspect_declared_meters( instance, self._inspection_duration) for meter_info in meter_infos: yield util.make_sample_from_instance( instance, name=meter_info.name, type=meter_info.type, unit=meter_info.unit, volume=meter_info.value ) except virt_inspector.InstanceNotFoundException as err: # Instance was deleted while getting samples. Ignore it. LOG.debug(_('Exception while getting samples %s'), err) except NotImplementedError: # Selected inspector does not implement this pollster. LOG.debug(_('%(inspector)s does not provide data for ' ' %(pollster)s'), {'inspector': manager.inspector.__class__.__name__, 'pollster': self.__class__.__name__}) except Exception as err: instance_name = util.instance_name(instance) LOG.exception(_('Ignoring instance %(name)s: %(error)s'), {'name': instance_name, 'error': err})

subject: Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 20:44:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/a12653c82ab45f124f4d569f80ea6cc29a6da152', 'message': 'Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm

Dead loop scenario:
1. assume we have threhold alarm C, D
2. then we create combination alarm A with alarm_ids = C, D
3. and we create combination alarm B with alarm_ids = A
4. then we update alarm A with alarm_ids = B
5. then when evaluator alarm state, the two combination alarm is a dead loop

We should avoid such secnarios

The basic idea is that:
* all threshold alarms are good alarm, which definitely have no dependency,
  so there is no dead loop
* all alarms only depend on good alarms are good alarms

Note that we can update an alarm with enabled=False, in such case, no matter
there is a dead loop or not, we will allow it, since it will not be evaluated
in alarm-evaluator service. But the side effect is when we enable an alarm,
we should check dead loop no matter we change the alarm_ids or not.

Change-Id: Ic4065db9243fb209026e6f5b154e19a705992607
Closes-Bug: #1309182

We should avoid such secnarios

The basic idea is that:

* all alarms only depend on good alarms are good alarms

Note that we can update an alarm with enabled=False, in such case, no matter
there is a dead loop or not, we will allow it, since it will not be evaluated
in alarm-evaluator service. But the side effect is when we enable an alarm,
we should check dead loop no matter we change the alarm_ids or not.

NOTE: If old environment already has dead loop combination alarms, after

commit_message:
Avoid dead loop when update combination alarm

Dead loop scenario:
1. assume we have threhold alarm C, D
2. then we create combination alarm A with alarm_ids = C, D
3. and we create combination alarm B with alarm_ids = A
4. then we update alarm A with alarm_ids = B
5. then when evaluator alarm state, the two combination alarm is a dead loop

We should avoid such scenario

The basic idea is the following:
* all threshold alarms are good alarms, which definitely have no dependency,
  so there is no dead loop
* all alarms depending only on good alarms are good alarms

NOTE: This patch forbids updating alarm which will cause dead loop even though
it is disabled.

NOTE: If old environment already has dead loop combination alarms, after
upgrade with this patch, put /alarms/{id} api may not work util dead loop is
removed.

Change-Id: Ic4065db9243fb209026e6f5b154e19a705992607
Closes-Bug: #1309182
Implements: blueprint resolve-combination-alarm-dependency-chain
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/31/88431/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_put_combination_alarm_cause_dead_loop(self): alarms = self.get_json('/alarms', q=[{'field': 'name', 'value': 'name4', }]) self.assertEqual(1, len(alarms)) alarm_id = alarms[0]['alarm_id'] json_body = { 'name': 'bomb_alarm', 'type': 'combination', 'combination_rule': { 'alarm_ids': [alarm_id], } } self.post_json('/alarms', params=json_body, status=201, headers=self.auth_headers) alarms = list(self.conn.get_alarms(name='bomb_alarm')) self.assertEqual(1, len(alarms)) bomb_alarm_id = alarms[0].alarm_id # trigger dead loop json_body = { 'name': 'name4', 'type': 'combination', 'combination_rule': { 'alarm_ids': [bomb_alarm_id], } } resp = self.put_json('/alarms/%s' % alarm_id, params=json_body, expect_errors=True, status=400, headers=self.auth_headers) msg = 'Dead loop detected in all alarms dependency' self.assertEqual(msg, resp.json['error_message']['faultstring']) def test_put_combination_alarm_cause_dead_loop_with_enable(self): alarms = self.get_json('/alarms', q=[{'field': 'name', 'value': 'name4', }]) self.assertEqual(1, len(alarms)) alarm_id = alarms[0]['alarm_id'] json_body = { 'name': 'bomb_alarm', 'type': 'combination', 'combination_rule': { 'alarm_ids': [alarm_id], } } self.post_json('/alarms', params=json_body, status=201, headers=self.auth_headers) alarms = list(self.conn.get_alarms(name='bomb_alarm')) self.assertEqual(1, len(alarms)) bomb_alarm_id = alarms[0].alarm_id # trigger dead loop but disable the alarm json_body = { 'name': 'name4', 'type': 'combination', 'combination_rule': { 'enabled': False, 'alarm_ids': [bomb_alarm_id], } } self.put_json('/alarms/%s' % alarm_id, params=json_body, status=200, headers=self.auth_headers) alarms = list(self.conn.get_alarms(alarm_id=alarm_id)) self.assertEqual(1, len(alarms)) self.assertEqual([bomb_alarm_id], alarms[0].rule.get('alarm_ids')) # enable alarm to trigger dead loop without change alarm_ids json_body['combination_rule']['enabled'] = True resp = self.put_json('/alarms/%s' % alarm_id, params=json_body, expect_errors=True, status=400, headers=self.auth_headers) msg = 'Dead loop detected in all alarms dependency' self.assertEqual(msg, resp.json['error_message']['faultstring'])

commit_message:
Correct the position of the syslog handler

Correct the position of the syslog handler,
then the syslog handler can have same settings with
other handlers.

Change-Id: I75b4136cf880bb54e0b7ecf809487a8a20db4569
Closes-Bug: #1399088

commit_message:
Developer manual install docs

There are no developer installation docs for a manual install.
This patch provides baseline developer docs for setting up a searchlight
dev environment.

Separate docs for devstack or other mechanisms will be in a different patch.

Change-Id: I6d2d7d9a800c8db438b4e6716a4da395f3541921
Closes-Bug: #1470194
Co-Authored-By: Lakshmi N Sampath <lakshmi.sampath@hp.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/32/197232/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. c) Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. *********************** Development Environment *********************** This guide will walk you through setting up a typical development environment. You may set it up using devstack or manually. .. _Manual Development Environment: Manual Development Environment ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ Prerequesites ============= Install prerequisites:: # Ubuntu/Debian: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install python-dev libssl-dev python-pip libmysqlclient-dev \ libxml2-dev libxslt-dev libpq-dev git git-review \ libffi-dev gettext python-tox # Fedora/RHEL: sudo yum install python-devel openssl-devel python-pip mysql-devel \ libxml2-devel libxslt-devel postgresql-devel git \ git-review libffi-devel gettext # openSUSE/SLE 12: sudo zypper install git git-review libffi-devel libmysqlclient-devel \ libopenssl-devel libxml2-devel libxslt-devel \ postgresql-devel python-devel python-flake8 \ python-nose python-pip python-setuptools-git \ python-testrepository python-tox python-virtualenv \ gettext-runtime sudo easy_install nose sudo pip install virtualenv setuptools-git flake8 tox testrepository If using RHEL and yum reports "No package python-pip available" and "No package git-review available", use the EPEL software repository. Instructions can be found at `<http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/EPEL/FAQ#howtouse>`_. You may need to explicitly upgrade virtualenv if you've installed the one from your OS distribution and it is too old (tox will complain). You can upgrade it individually, if you need to:: sudo pip install -U virtualenv This guide assumes that you also have the following services minimally available: * ElasticSearch * Keystone Additional services required to be installed will depend on the plugins activated in searchlight. Installing Searchlight ====================== .. index:: double: install; searchlight 1. Install system package dependencies (Ubuntu) :: $ sudo apt-get update $ sudo apt-get install python-dev libssl-dev python-pip libmysqlclient-dev libxml2-dev libxslt-dev libpq-dev git git-review libffi-dev gettext python-tox $ sudo easy_install nose $ sudo pip install virtualenv setuptools-git flake8 tox testrepository 2. Clone the Searchlight repo from GitHub :: $ mkdir openstack $ cd openstack $ git clone https://github.com/openstack/searchlight.git $ cd searchlight 3. Setup a virtualenv .. note:: This is an optional step, but will allow Searchlight's dependencies to be installed in a contained environment that can be easily deleted if you choose to start over or uninstall Searchlight. :: $ tox -evenv --notest Activate the virtual environment whenever you want to work in it. All further commands in this section should be run with the venv active: :: $ source .tox/venv/bin/activate When ALL steps are complete, deactivate the virtualenv: :: $ deactivate 4. Install Searchlight and its dependencies :: $ python setup.py develop 5. Create sample config. :: $ oslo-config-generator --config-file etc/oslo-config-generator/searchlight-api.conf 6. Create Searchlight's config files by copying the sample config files :: $ cd etc/ $ ls *.sample | while read f; do cp $f $(echo $f | sed "s/.sample$//g"); done 7. Make the directory for Searchlights log files :: $ mkdir -p ../log 8. Make the directory for Searchlights state files :: $ mkdir -p ../state Configuring Searchlight ====================== .. index:: double: configure; searchlight Open the searchlight-api.conf file for editing :: $ editor searchlight-api.conf Initialize the Elasticsearch Index ================================== .. index:: double: install; sync Perform initial sync of the resources to ElasticSearch. All plugins for searchlight must have their services installed and available at an endpoint registered in keystone (e.g. glance). :: # Make sure your virtualenv is sourced $ source .tox/venv/bin/activate $ searchlight-index Initialize & Start the API Service ================================== .. index:: double: install; api Open up a new ssh window and log in to your server (or however youre communicating with your server). :: $ cd <install dir. eg: openstack/searchlight> # Make sure your virtualenv is sourced $ source .tox/venv/bin/activate # Start the API Service $ searchlight-api --config-file etc/searchlight-api.conf Youll should now see the log from the API service. Exercising the API ================== .. note:: If you have a firewall enabled, make sure to open port 9393. Using a web browser, curl statement, or a REST client, calls can be made to the Searchlight API using the following format where "api_version" is v1 and "command" is any of the commands listed under the api :ref:`searchlightapi` :: http://IP.Address:9393/api_version/command You can find the IP Address of your server by running :: curl -s checkip.dyndns.org | sed -e 's/.*Current IP Address: //' -e 's/<.*$//'

Improved README-bagpipe for devstack use

More information:
- what enable_service statement to use
- how to run fakerr

Change-Id: Id4fd4bb678ca1686ede1af8ab942ad9e920bbf0c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/26/198126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * on a control node, if you want to run the Fake Route Reflector there:: enable_plugin bagpipe-bgp https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/bagpipe-bgp.git enable_service b-fakerr * install and configure bagpipe-bgp_, typically with a peering to a BGP Route Reflector or BGP routers, can be done through devstack like this:: enable_plugin bagpipe-bgp https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/bagpipe-bgp.git BAGPIPE_DATAPLANE_DRIVER_IPVPN = mpls_ovs_dataplane.MPLSOVSDataplaneDriver # IP of your route reflector or BGP router, or fakeRR # (typically $SERVICE_HOST on compute node, if the control node is running the RR) BAGPIPE_BGP_PEERS=1.2.3.4 enable_service b-bgp
deleted_lines: * install and configure bagpipe-bgp_, typically with a peering to a BGP Route Reflector or BGP routers enable_plugin bagpipe-bgp https://github.com/Orange-OpenSource/bagpipe-bgp.git BAGPIPE_DATAPLANE_DRIVER_IPVPN = mpls_ovs_dataplane.MPLSOVSDataplaneDriver # IP of your route reflector or BGP router, or fakeRR: BAGPIPE_BGP_PEERS=1.2.3.4

commit_message:
Rename Puppet jobs to avoid word duplication

Currently, jobs are named (example with puppet-heat):
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-lint
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-syntax
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-unit-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-beaker-rspec-upgrade-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-puppet-syntax-future

Let's rename all of them to:
gate-puppet-heat-lint
gate-puppet-heat-syntax
gate-puppet-heat-unit-X
gate-puppet-heat-beaker-rspec-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-beaker-rspec-upgrade-dsvm-X
gate-puppet-heat-syntax-future

With the goal to improve readability.

Change-Id: Ia2ff46f89c90dceff3f614884b2a0cc3e0d5a13c

commit_message:
glance:check the num_retries option

Ensure that the glance num_retries option is equal or bigger than 0,done
like that the configuration item network_allocate_retries

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Closes-Bug: #1372426
Change-Id: I6a8fd8a2fe7e4b105aaaab8af8be250d9b0f9056

commit_message:
Fixed the upgrade script edge case

Changed the command to find the containers to only look for the contianer
config file within a given directory and to only look one level deep.
This change is in response to an issue that can happen if the container
directory "/var/lib/lxc" is also a mounted file system.

Change-Id: Id39995580900e2b9d9a35435d0cfeba82075d62b
Closes-Bug: #1470571
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/57/197657/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: command: "find /var/lib/lxc -maxdepth 2 -type f -name 'config'" if [ "\$(grep '^lxc.network.name = eth0' {{ item }})" ];then grep '^lxc.network.name = eth0' -A1 -B3 {{ item }} | tee {{ item | dirname }}/eth0.ini if [ ! "\$(grep '{{ item | dirname }}/eth0.ini' {{ item }})" ];then echo 'lxc.include = {{ item | dirname }}/eth0.ini' | tee -a {{ item }} dest: "{{ item }}" dest: "{{ item }}" dest: "{{ item }}" path: "{{ item | dirname }}/add_network_interface.conf"
deleted_lines: command: ls -1 /var/lib/lxc if [ "\$(grep '^lxc.network.name = eth0' /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config)" ];then grep '^lxc.network.name = eth0' -A1 -B3 /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config | tee /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/eth0.ini if [ ! "\$(grep '/var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/eth0.ini' /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config)" ];then echo 'lxc.include = /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/eth0.ini' | tee -a /var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config dest: "/var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config" dest: "/var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config" dest: "/var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/config" path: "/var/lib/lxc/{{ item }}/add_network_interface.conf"

commit_message:
Stop using these variables

In order to register this plugin and its extensions, it suffices
adding the extension path to the list of the ones to be loaded.

commit_message:
Rabbit config changes dont initiate a restart

Restart rabbit-server when the config files change. This required
the templates to be rendered from the post_install playbook to
prevent attempting to restart a service that had not yet been
installed.

Change-Id: I7c9ba030aa0e58d3fb5fa3cb6f17dd013f36471c
Closes-Bug: #1460115
(cherry picked from commit 90bef6a3c47580aaf99b81c6842404e027e01924)

commit_message:
Use old puppet syntax job on system-config

The infra puppet modules do not yet have Gemfiles like the OpenStack
puppet modules do. For now, they have to use the macro to perform the
task. As the infra modules start supporting the standard method, these
can be converted to puppet-check-jobs.

Change-Id: I698162023e9a7be0bef375c092dd6a70535b8bb2

commit_message:
Use the correct upstream repos.

github.com's repos are a mirror of the openstack.org primary repos.
We should use the openstack.org ones.

Change-Id: Id2bae517c7972b8553b63b92dccffa8d32231f3f

commit_message:
Replace screenshots in User Guide

Replaces the following screenshots in user guide with new ones:
- for Install Fuel Master Node
- for Fuel Setup
- for Network Setup
- for PXE Setup
- for DNS & Hostname
- for Time sync with NTP
- for Fuel login
Removes the screenshot and info for docker0.
Removes the text (and screenshot accordingly) about
the showmenu option as now it's showmenu=yes
by default.
Adds a screenshot for Quit Setup.

Change-Id: I5956aef7a7d8965c64447cfe06942ffcba64f2a5
Closes-Bug: #1469141
Closes-Bug: #1469146

Remove unused linux bridge agent configuration options

This is cruft left from the Linux bridge monolithic plugin,
or from pre-Havana versions of the code.

commit_message:
Remove old function extract_env_version

Until now we have two functions which were doing the same
The patch unifies it as follows:
* Rename Release model property from 'fuel_version'
  to 'environment_version' to make it more descriptive
* remove extract_env_version function, and replace it with
  environment_version property in Release model.

Closes-Bug: #1470524
Closes-Bug: #1470768
Change-Id: I7688f048468d6036fb326be82049ec50a7925386

commit_message:
One network stack to rule them all

Nova has been trying to move to supporting a single network stack based
on neutron for several years now, and we are stuck in a bad place where
we support two separate network stacks. After numerous failed attempts to
change the default networking solution to neutron and start the
deprecation process for nova-networking, it is time to resolve this once
and for all.
Just deprecate nova's neutron support.

DNM

Change-Id: Ifd7481744891668e3a8b4398867778a952053c50
